tasks.task: Check and operate a solar-powered water pump for cattle.
subtasks: Examine the four-panel solar system setup.
Verify the cable route under the road.
Assess water source suction lift capability.
Monitor pump performance and water quantity.

tasks.task: Install and maintain a solar water pumping system.
subtasks: Evaluate system efficiency for hilltop water supply.
Address seasonal operational requirements (e.g., winter use).
Troubleshoot and resolve issues (if any).
Highlight customer satisfaction with product performance.
Encourage potential buyers to contact the company for inquiries.

tasks.task: Check and operate a solar-powered water pump for cattle. That covers the immediate action of making sure the pump is working and supplying water as intended.

Promote solar-powered agricultural equipment. But under that, the subtasks there might be highlighting customer satisfaction by saying "some people out there pretty happy with it" and encouraging viewers to call for more info.

But the main tasks related to the physical inspection and operation of the pump are the initial MAINTASK and its subtasks. The other part is more promotional, but since we usually focus on tasks that a person would physically perform, the promotional part might not count unless they're (the people in the video) actually performing those actions, like talking to potential customers. But in this context, probably not. So maybe separate them. So I'll stick to the tasks related to the pump's operation and installation.
5. Promote the product (MAINTASK), but that's a bit of a stretch if the person isn’t directly doing that. Hmm.
Check and operate a solar-powered water pump for cattle.
Check and operate... would be sufficient.
